p: In the case of S. hortensis L., the components identified by GC-MS analysis of the volatile oil extracted from leaves were carvacrol (54.069%), γ-terpinene (26.749%), and m-cymene (7.996%) ( Table S1). The herbal EOs composition from four chemotypes of this species have been reported previously, containing specific combinations of components: (1) thymol and α-terpinene, (2) thymol and carvacrol, (3) carvacrol and α-terpinene, and (4) thymol [ 18]. Yazdanpanah and Mohamadi (2014) reported a similar composition for S. hortensis L. volatile oil extracted by hydrodistillation [ 19].
